name: sing
content:
sing verb
(MAKE MUSIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 [ I or T ] to make musical sounds with the voice, usually a tune with words: The children sang two songs by Schubert at the school concert. We were woken early by the sound of the birds singing. Your grandmother would like you to sing for/to her. [ + two objects ] Will you sing us a song/sing a song to us? She sang her baby to sleep every night. Pavarotti is singing Rodolfo (= singing the part of Rodolfo) in "La Bohème" at La Scala this week. You need to sing up (= sing louder).
More examplesFewer examplesThere's no need to hang back - you can sing as well as anyone.So let's have a round of applause, please, for a very lovely and talented young lady who is going to sing for us.The children will first sing individually and then together as a group.And then he started to sing. Well, I didn't know where to put myself.He started to sing professionally after leaving college.
